doc.after: Grammatical person in linguistics is the grammatical distinction between deictic references to participant s in an event typically the distinction is between the speaker the addressee and others Grammatical person typically defines a language s set of personal pronouns It also frequently affects verbs sometimes nouns and possessive relationships
